text.headline: Soviet Invasion of Poland
text.text: Following the Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact, the Soviet Union invaded eastern Poland, leading to its occupation.

text.headline: Winter War
text.text: The Soviet Union attacked Finland, initiating the Winter War, which lasted until March 1940.

media.caption: Finnish soldiers during the Winter War.

text.headline: Invasion of Czechoslovakia
text.text: Warsaw Pact troops, led by the Soviet Union, invaded Czechoslovakia to halt the Prague Spring reforms.

media.caption: Soviet tanks in Prague during the 1968 invasion.

text.headline: Soviet Invasion of Afghanistan
text.text: The Soviet Union deployed troops to Afghanistan, initiating a conflict that lasted until 1989.

text.headline: Russo-Georgian War
text.text: Russia engaged in a conflict with Georgia over the regions of South Ossetia and Abkhazia.

media.caption: Russian tanks moving through South Ossetia, 2008.

text.headline: Annexation of Crimea
text.text: Russia annexed the Crimean Peninsula from Ukraine, leading to international condemnation.

media.caption: Map depicting the annexation of Crimea, 2014.

text.headline: Invasion of Ukraine
text.text: Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, escalating the ongoing conflict that began in 2014.

media.caption: Russian military vehicles advancing into Ukraine, 2022.
